as.leap

Class LCACL

  • java.lang.Object
    • as.leap.LCACL

  • public class LCACL
extends java.lang.Object
    A LCACL is used to control which users can access or modify a particular object. Each LCObject can have its own LCACL. You can grant read and write permissions separately to specific users, to groups of users that belong to roles, or you can grant permissions to "the public" so that, for example, any user could read a particular object but only a particular set of users could write to that object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LCACL()
      Creates an ACL with no permissions granted.
      LCACL(LCUser owner)
      Creates an ACL where only the provided user has access.

      • LCACL

        public LCACL(LCUser owner)
        Creates an ACL where only the provided user has access.
        Parameters:
        owner - The only user that can read or write objects governed by this ACL.

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultACL

        public static void setDefaultACL(LCACL acl,
                                 boolean withAccessForCurrentUser)
        Sets a default ACL that will be applied to all LCObjects when they are created.
        Parameters:
        acl - The ACL to use as a template for all LCObjects created after setDefaultACL has been called. This value will be copied and used as a template for the creation of new ACLs, so changes to the instance after setDefaultACL() has been called will not be reflected in new LCObjects.
        withAccessForCurrentUser - If true, the LCACL that is applied to newly-created LCObjects will provide read and write access to the LCUser.getCurrentUser() at the time of creation. If false, the provided ACL will be used without modification. If acl is null, this value is ignored.

      • getRoleReadAccess

        public boolean getRoleReadAccess(java.lang.String roleName)
        Get whether users belonging to the role with the given roleName are allowed to read this object. Even if this returns false, the role may still be able to read it if a parent role has read access.
        Parameters:
        roleName - The name of the role.
        Returns:
        If the role has read access. false otherwise.

      • getRoleReadAccess

        public boolean getRoleReadAccess(LCRole role)
        Get whether users belonging to the given role are allowed to read this object. Even if this returns false, the role may still be able to read it if a parent role has read access. The role must already be saved on the server and its data must have been fetched in order to use this method.
        Parameters:
        role - The role to check for access.
        Returns:
        If the role has read access. false otherwise.

      • getRoleWriteAccess

        public boolean getRoleWriteAccess(LCRole role)
        Get whether users belonging to the given role are allowed to write this object. Even if this returns false, the role may still be able to write it if a parent role has write access. The role must already be saved on the server and its data must have been fetched in order to use this method.
        Parameters:
        role - The role to check for access.
        Returns:
        If the role has write access. false otherwise.

      • getWriteAccess

        public boolean getWriteAccess(LCUser user)
        Get whether the given user id isallowed to write this object. Even if this returns false, the user may still be able to write it if getPublicWriteAccess returns true or a role that the user belongs to has write access.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        write access
